Name: stars
Blurb: The stars you see in the night sky are actually balls of fire like our sun, though they’re much father away.

Name: kepler51d
Blurb: Outside our solar system there are trillions more planets, like this one: Kepler-51 d, one of the planets discovered by the Kepler Space Telescope.

Name: white dwarf
Blurb: These glowing white stars are actually what stars like our sun become after they’ve used up all of their nuclear energy.

Name: neutron star
Blurb: A neutron star is the collapsed core of a supergiant star, an especially bright and large star, created after a supernova explosion.

Name: black hole
Blurb: A region where gravity is so strong, nothing - not even light - can escape it. The point of no escape from a black hole is called the event horizon.

Name: red dwarf
Blurb: Though they can’t be easily observed due to their low light, red dwarfs are the most common kind of star in the Milky Way.
